entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
05/24 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the two-hundred-eleventh edition:

Markus
  • Logical Replication in PostgreSQL 10 - One of the big new features in the next version of PostgreSQL, whose first beta was just released.
  • How Technology Hijacks People’s Minds — from a Magician and Google’s Design Ethicist - Design matters, more in than just the obvious ways.
  • 10 things I learned making the fastest site in the world - Some interesting techniques to speed up web page loading and rendering.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
05/17 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the two-hundred-tenth edition:

Markus
  • Programming with a love of the implicit - DHH argues against “it’s always better to be explicit”
  • NASA’s ten coding commandments - Maybe following them everywhere would improve software quality in general? (although some of the rules are quite specific to low-level languages)
  • The Architects Below - Software influences behavior, often with implications that we software developers rarely think about when gathering requirements or building software.
Max
  • Untangling Ruby Threads - Great real world example (and explanation) of using threads in Ruby.
  • Insomnia - An interesting free and open source alternative to Postman.
  • Teaching RSpec to Play nice with Rails - The awesome Sam Phippen shares some insights on making RSpec compatible with Rails 5.1.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
05/10 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the two-hundred-ninth edition:

Markus
  • Postgres tips for Rails developers - A grab-bag of useful tips and tricks for using PostgreSQL with Rails.
  • Lies My Parents Told Me (About Logs) - Important facs about logs and logging.
  • How I converted my React app to VanillaJS (and whether or not it was a terrible idea) - This new VanillaJS framework looks really great and performant.
Max
  • thefuck - Extend “did you mean” to your terminal.
  • Factory Girl Instruments - Benchmark, trace and debug the base of your test suite: your factories.
  • Get started making music - Neat project by Ableton to teach the basics of making music in the browser.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
05/03 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the two-hundred-eighth edition:

Markus
  • Why Is Ruby Multithreading Slow? - Multithreading is hard, and it’s easy to do something wrong that impacts performance severely.
  • acli - Action Cable command-line client - For trying out, testing, and debugging.
  • mailcatcher - Catches mail and serves it through a dream - For easy testing and debugging sending mails.
Max
  • What Are Your Career Goals? - Interesting discussion over at dev.to.
  • Workflow - Awesome talk on dev workflows and though processes by searls.
  • GitHub::DS - Set of Ruby libs by Github to conveniently work with SQL on top of the ActiveRecord connection.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
04/26 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the two-hundred-seventh edition:

Markus
  • When debugging doesn’t suck: beautiful errors - Improving your error messages can be the difference between a difficult to debug problem, or a quick discovery of the underlying cause.
  • Syntactic Diabetes
  • The Inside Story Behind MS08-067 - How a nasty zero-day was discovered by Microsoft, and how the issue was handled internally.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
04/19 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the two-hundred-sixth edition:

Markus
  • Versioning a Rails API - Thoughts on multiple strategies on how to version your API
  • Rails Benchmarking: Puma and MultiProcess - How to figure out how many threads and processes to configure Puma with. The actual numbers aren’t that interesting, but the way to get there is what’s important.
  • cssreference.io - For when you don’t remember what a (popular) CSS property actually does: this includes visual examples.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
04/12 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the two-hundred-fifth edition:

Markus
  • Better Rails 5 API Controller Tests with RSpec Shared Examples - Great tips on testing your Rails API (Although you should avoid using JWT or JOSE)
  • My Response to “How to never complete anything” - Deconstructs some “common wisdom” around productivity.
  • Kill “Microservices” before its too late by Chad Fowler (Rocky Mountain Ruby 2016)
Max
  • Rails vs. … - Funny video series by Jason Seifer (RIP) and Gregg Pollack from 10 years ago.
  • Building Component-Based Front Ends with Rails - Interesting approach on organizing front end code in Rails apps.
  • LEGO Macintosh Classic - Mindblowing and super cute DIY project.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
04/05 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the two-hundred-fourth edition:

Markus
  • Dark Patterns: User Interfaces Designed to Trick People - A presentation on anti-patterns in UI design.
  • Seamless socket server restarts in Ruby - aka “How does Puma et al. implement hot restarts?”
  • HTML5 Security Cheat Sheet - A list of HTML5-features that can lead to XSS and other security-related problems.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
03/29 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the two-hundred-third edition:

Markus
  • Can’t crack that programming problem? Go to sleep (or take a walk)
  • Porting Ruby to Crystal - Distributing Ruby programs to clients can be tricky regarding packaging. Converting to Crystal might just be the answer you’re looking for.
  • Bash scripting quirks & safety tips - Even in these times, a shell script is the best solution to a problem. Julia Evans has some tips, tricks, and warnings for you.
Max
  • fzf - A blazing fast, customizable, general purpose command-line fuzzy finder.
  • Simplifying Your Transition from Macro to Microservices - Tips for tackling your legacy Macroservices.
  • Ida Tin’s battle to build Clue - On the struggles one still has to face when trying to launch menstruation-related products like Clue.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
03/22 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the two-hundred-second edition:

Markus
  • Ruby Methods, Procs and Blocks - A dive into the more unknown corners of Ruby’s syntax and behaviors (Part 2, Part 3)
  • Unicode Normalization in Ruby - What Unicode normalization actually does, and why it can have security implications for your apps.
  • Designing robust and predictable APIs with idempotency - Stripe needs their product to be very reliable, and it reflects in their API design.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
03/15 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the two-hundred-first edition:

Markus
  • The 4-letter-word word that makes my blood boil - I’m guilty of overusing it.
  • How to perform a good code review - A very good reference post.
  • Setting up a Rust Development Environment - If you want to get started with Rust, this post will get you off the ground.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
03/08 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the two-hundredth edition:

Markus
  • How to Stop Hating Your Tests - How your tests can go wrong, and what to do about it.
  • Testing Ruby’s Unicode Support - It’s definitely improved since 1.8, but there are still some pitfalls you should be aware of.
  • Communicating Intent - How to use Rust’s type system to communicate intent.
Max
  • Data Transfer Object in Ruby - DTOs, a helpful pattern to save your business logic from getting too cluttered with huge parameter lists and data transformations.
  • A Career Retrospective - Somewhat alarming, sad but also inspiring writeup of “10 years working in tech” by the awesome Sailor Mercury.
  • Phoenix 1.3 - Interesting talk on the changes in Phoenix and the thoughts and motivation behind them.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
03/01 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the one-hundred-ninety-ninth edition:

Markus
  • Upgrade Ruby, find a bug - Upgrading to Ruby 2.4 revealed a bug in the way dotenv was used to load values.
  • Ruby Debugging Magic Cheat Sheet - If you’re chasing a tricky bug, Richard Schneeman has a few handy tricks for you.
  • Is PostgreSQL good enough? - Why and how PostgreSQL can be a “good enough” solution for many problems you’ll encounter.
Max
  • Join Basecamp - How Basecamp is hiring non-rockstars.
  • ORM: We Approve - Another nifty usage example for approval tests.
  • Reflecting On One Very, Very Strange Year At Uber - In case you thought things are going well at Uber.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
02/22 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the one-hundred-ninety-eighth edition:

Laura
  • Getting started with vim - A really good post and collection of resources combined in an intuitive way for vim beginners!
  • Exploring unseen Open Source infrastructure - A ton of projects rely on Open Source infrastructure that is “invisible” and often mistaken for unimportant. In this post, Andrew Nesbitt presents a small feature of his project libraries.io to help us be aware of those projects.
Markus
  • Programmer, Interrupted
  • The Dark Standup
  • Don’t overlook the quiet voices and contributions - It’s easy to listen to the loud voices. But the quiet ones are just as important, but not as easy to listen to.
Ben
  • Kiba ETL - Need to setup a ETL pipeline? This little nifty Ruby Gem gets you started.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
02/15 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the one-hundred-ninety-seventh edition:

Markus
  • Fix the internet by writing good stuff and being nice to people
  • Rules of programming experiments
  • How I fixed my biggest mistake with implementing background jobs
Max
  • Approvals - Nifty testing tool by the awesome Katrina Owen - practical for things like testing serializers.
  • Investment Time - Part of what makes Thoughtbot so cool.
  • rubocop –auto-gen-config - Awesome strategy for approaching legacy codebases with Rubocop.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
02/08 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the one-hundred-ninety-sixth edition:

Markus
  • Foggy thinking in design (and how to cut through it) - While this article deals with design, you can easily apply it to programming.
  • howfuckedismydatabase.com
  • How to Build a Skyscraper by Ernie Miller (RailsConf 2016) - This is not a talk about how to build a skyscraper.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
02/01 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the one-hundred-ninety-fifth edition:

Markus
  • The Kill List - Productivity is as much about what you say no to as what you say yes to.
  • htop Explained Visually
  • The Ruby terminal apps toolkit - Everything you need to build an app for the terminal.
Max
  • JSONAPI-RB - New favorite tool for doing anything json:api related in Ruby.
  • What HTTP/2 Means for Ruby Developers - Sneak peak into how Ruby apps would benefit from HTTP/2 and how it would demand developers to rethink current best practices.
  • dry-struct - Awesome tool for building convenient model-like structs in Ruby.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
01/25 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the one-hundred-ninety-fourth edition:

Markus
  • Everything you need to know about HTTP security headers - Ever got confused what the various HTTP security headers do, and how to use them?
  • The SaaS CTO Security Checklist - A handy list of things to secure and harden.
  • Choose Boring Technology - New technology is exciting, but also contains a lot of unknowns.
Max
  • Stackoverflow Developer Survey - 2017 edition of Stackoverflow’s developer survey.
  • 12 Signs you’re working in a feature factory - Awesome checklist on what’s likely to go wrong in software development processes.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
01/11 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the one-hundred-ninety-third edition:

Ramón
  • vim-nerdtree-tabs - A Vim plugin allowing NERDtree and tabs to work together.
  • Memrise - Free-ish platform for learning spoken languages, with videos of natives speaking!
  • Vienna BEAMers - A bi-weekly Elixir study group held here in Vienna.
Markus
  • Ruby 2.4 Released: Faster Hashes, Unified Integers and Better Rounding
  • How to ask good questions - An essential guide.
  • Writing software is hard - We all know it, but we’re still shocked when we encounter bad software.
Max
  • Building an Umbrella Project - Awesome talk on Elixir (& Phoenix) umbrella apps vs. microservices.
  • rubocop_runner - Nifty little tool used at Runtastic to prevent devs from committing non-Rubocop-confirm code.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
01/04 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the one-hundred-ninety-second edition:

Markus
  • Jessica Rose - Imposter Syndrome and Individual Competence
  • Is the Ballmer Peak real? - From this XKCD comic.
  • Choose an open source license - It’s a new year, you might have made a resolution to make a new open source project, and you’ll need a license for it.
